nodes.name: DocumentToText
nodes.description: The DocumentToText node extracts text content from documents, including PDF, TXT, DOCX, and image files, located in a specified file path or directory. It processes either a single file or an entire directory, producing a structured DataFrame with columns for the extracted text, file name, page numbers, and optionally, base64-encoded data for PDFs and images.

fields.title: Document Type
fields.description: Choose a Document Type.If Empty all four types of files will be processed.

fields.title: Recursive
fields.description: Recursively process the documents in the given Directory

nodes.name: Print N Rows
nodes.description: Prints the specified number of records in the DataFrame. It is useful for seeing intermediate output
nodes.details:
Print N Rows Node Details


This node is used to print the first N rows from the incoming dataframe.

The Number of rows that needs to be printed can be configured in the node.

Input Parameters

  • OUTPUT STORAGE LEVEL : Keep this as DEFAULT.
  • TITLE : Enter a short description for the type of information being displayed.
  • NUM ROWS TO PRINT : Set an integer value(N) which controls the number of rows to be displayed(Default N=10).
  • DISPLAY DATA TYPE : Shows the output dataframe column datatypes by default.

Output

  • This node can be used to view, analyze and validate the output of the Dataframe.
nodes.examples:
when input 5 in no of rows,it will show first 5 rows of the table as follows

PartID SupplierID PartName

P9271 S798 Part_D
P523 S955 Part_K
P3201 S332 Part_M
P9634 S527 Part_G
P9345 S850 Part_M

nodes.name: Multi LLM Query
nodes.description: The Multi LLM Query node is designed to query multiple large language models (LLMs) from providers such as OpenAI, Bedrock, and Gemini, using a DataFrame as input. It processes user queries, text content, and/or base64-encoded images to generate responses based on the selected model and task, producing a structured DataFrame output.

fields.name: storageLevel
fields.title: Output Storage Level
fields.description: Storage Level of the Output Datasets of this Node

fields.title: Select Connection
fields.description: Select Connection

fields.title: Temperature
fields.description: Temperature setting for the model (default: 0).

fields.title: Content Column
fields.description: Column name for the text content.

fields.name: imageCol
fields.title: Image Column
fields.description: Column name for the base 64 image.

fields.name: inputMode
fields.title: Mode Selection
fields.description: Select the model to use (text, image, text+image).

fields.name: task
fields.title: Select Prompt
fields.description: Specify the task to perform: summary, translation, topic extraction, or other.

optionsMap.summary: Generate a concise, multi-level bullet-point summary capturing key facts, insights, and implications from the content. Preserve structure and section hierarchy.
optionsMap.translation: Translate the content into fluent, formal English while preserving tone, context, cultural nuances, and domain-specific terminology (e.g., legal, medical, technical).
optionsMap.topic_extraction: Identify and extract key topics, subtopics, and entities. Categorize them with tags (e.g., Person, Location, Concept) and provide brief descriptions or summaries of each.

fields.name: customPrompt
fields.value:
Identification:
- "Does the marketing communication include a clear statement identifying it as such, including the terms 'marketing communication'?"
- "Is there a disclaimer present that refers to the relevant prospectus or KIID/KID for further information?"
Risk and Reward Disclosure:
- "Is information on risks and rewards given with equal prominence in terms of placement, font size, and style?"
- "Is the description of risks integrated within the main body of the text rather than hidden in footnotes?"
Fair, Clear, and Not Misleading Information:
- "Is the language used in the communication clear and free of excessive technical jargon?"
- "Does the communication avoid making misleading statements or omissions that could mislead investors?"
Consistency with Legal Documents:
- "Are the details provided in the marketing communication consistent with the prospectus, KIID/KID, and other regulatory documents of the fund?"
- "Do any figures or claims about performance, costs, or returns match those in the legal documents?"
Investment Features Description:
- "Does the content describe the investment policy accurately and clearly?"
- "Is there a clear explanation of the types of assets into which the fund may invest?"
- "If leverage is mentioned, is there an explanation of how it affects potential losses or returns?"
Presentation Quality:
- "Is the content presented in a readable format, with appropriate font size and style?"
- "Are audio/visual elements clear and easily understandable?"
- "Are all statements supported by objective, verifiable sources?"
- "Does the communication avoid implying endorsement or approval by national authorities?"ÃÂ 
I am providing a document text and some compliance checking questions regarding the documents.ÃÂ 
The questions are distributed among diffferent sections. Your task is to checking whther each compliance checking is present in the document or not. If one compliance check is there in the document then you can give a score 1 and if not present then give a score as 0.


Give me output strictly in the below json format
{
     "result": [
                       {"Section_name": "Name of the section",
                         "Compliance_check": "checking whether each compliance checking is present",
                          "Score": "1"},....
                   ]
}
 
Do not give any  unecessary output just give me the json, with right quotation so that it can be easily parsed by json.

Only give this data, not other stuff.

fields.name: thinkingBudget
fields.title: Thinking Budget
fields.description: Configure the Gemini thinking budget by specifying the number of tokens to allocate for thinking. For Flash and Flash Lite models, values can range from 0 to 24,576 or -1 for dynamic thinking. For 2.5 Pro model, values must be between 1 and 24,576; setting 0 is not allowed.

nodes.name: Save Parquet
nodes.description: Saves the DataFrame into the specified location in Parquet Format. When running on Hadoop, it is saved onto HDFS.
nodes.details:
Save Parquet Node Details


Saves the DataFrame into the specified location in Parquet Format. When running on Hadoop, it is saved onto HDFS.

Parameters to be set:

General:
  • OUTPUT STORAGE LEVEL : Keep this as DEFAULT.
  • PATH : Specify the path of the Parquet file to be saved.
  • SAVE MODE : Specify the save mode - Append, Overwrite, ErrorIfExists and Ignore.
  • PARTITION COLUMN NAMES : Specify the columns to be used for partitioning the Parquet files.
nodes.examples:
Save Parquet Node Examples


Example of Values

General:
  • PATH : /tmp/sample.parquet
  • SAVE MODE : Append
  • PARTITION COLUMN NAMES : col1,col2

fields.name: comment
fields.value:
1. Extract the text from PDF document
  2. Check the compliance for each and every section of that document using LLM
  3. Get the stringify json response from LLM and save it as a Parquet file
